entry.title: i can't save us
entry.summary:
Author: purexheart

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,160Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 37

Summary: Her parents had forced her to keep her life before Hershey a secret from her new friends. She couldnâ€™t talk about Daniel or the day he died. And she couldnâ€™t talk about the week after when her parents ripped Evan out of her life as well. At fifteen, Maddie started to form a plan to get out of town and try everything she can to track her brother down. At eighteen, she took off while her parents slept in a bed upstairs with no idea where to begin, just knowing she had to try. Or; The Buckleyâ€™s couldnâ€™t stand being reminded of Daniel every time they stare back into Evanâ€™s eyes. They put him up for adoption, move towns, and try to start again no matter how much pain that put their daughter in.

entry.title: the naked truth
entry.summary:
Author: madforyou

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,903Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 99

Summary: Eddieâ€™s already there, turning to wave, except when he sees Buck, his hand freezes mid-air, mouth falling open so wide it nearly hits the floor. Buck suddenly remembers he's wearing nothing but a towel. "Fuck," he says. Eddie's gaze drops, just for a second, a quick flick down and back up, but Buck catches it, and his face goes hot. He should get clothes. He should absolutely get clothes. He should turn around and walk to his bedroom and put on pants instead of not moving, naked and dripping in his living room. Eddie's face is turning red. He's still frozen with his hand half-raised, mouth slightly open, and Buck is having a hard time remembering why clothes are important when Eddie is looking at him like that. The towel betrays him, slipping with inconsiderate, dramatic timing. Buck lunges for it, misses, and is suddenly very, very naked. Or,Buck accidentally flashes his apartmentâ€™s window cleaner.

entry.title: baby, where the hell is my husband (what is taking him so long?)
entry.summary:
Author: queerbaited_by_ABC

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,215Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 200

Summary: "Hey, thing two!" Chim calls out from the patio doors, pointing back out to the backyard. "Can you come over here and rescue thing one from the girls? Bobby says he hasn't had any food yet and I'm not willing to get in between Buck and his uncle time." Chimney air-quotes, exasperated. Eddie scoffs, rolling his eyes. "Why am I thing two?" He asks, offended, though Eddies filling up a second plate the moment Maddie hands him one. His own plate is abandoned, baked goods laid to the side. "Shouldn't it be the other way around?" Chimney shrugs. "Eh details, Buck joined the 118 firstâ€”and I'm pretty sure you don't want me referring to him the way Hen does on your behalf." He teases, waggling his eyebrows. Eddie flushes, looking away from Maddies inquiring expression while he clears his throat. "Uhâ€”yeah, yeah no, don't use that wordâ€”I'll be right there."or: living with Buck is hard to describe, the experience has Eddie feeling like he's floating on cloud nine most days, but when the new HOA president, Jason, wages war with Eddie about the mango tree in their front yard (Bucks mango tree, to be specific), well, itâ€™s only natural that Eddie ends up proposing marriage about it.

entry.title: How to Disappear
entry.summary:
Author: noflamystique

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,219Chapters: 1/5Kudos: 35

Summary: Buck stopped in the middle of the street, his body finally rebelling. His hands trembled violently at his sides. His vision blurred, though he wasnâ€™t sure if it was from pain or something else entirely. Buck sank slowly to his knees, surrounded by the evidence of lives torn apart. He pressed a hand to his chest like he could physically hold himself together. â€œThis isn't happening,â€ he whispered again and again, to no one and everyone. The city lay in ruins around him, unrecognizable. And Buck understood, finally, nothing inside him would ever be the same. Christopher was dead. - Or: Buck vanishes in the aftermath of the tsunami, certain that Christopher is dead and that the loss is his fault. Seven years later, he returns to Los Angeles and learns just how wrong he was to leave.

entry.title: A Year Of You And Me
entry.summary:
Author: LibbyWrites

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,731Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 31

Summary: In spite of his skepticism, Eddie decides to start journaling, following his therapist's advice. The man gives him a list of 365 prompts and questions to write about each day, to help him untangle the mess his brain has become. Under the knots, he might find much more than just peace of mind.
